definition: lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
flag/variant of 旗[qi2]
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
old variant of 鼓[gu3]
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: Our products are almost on par with the best foreign-made products.
sentences.chinese: 我们的产品几乎与最好的外国货旗鼓相当。

sentences.english: The two teams well-matched, and the game was hotly contested.
sentences.chinese: 两个队旗鼓相当，打得十分激烈。

sentences.english: As a biologist, Lamarck was equal to Darwin.
sentences.chinese: 作为生物学家，拉马克与达尔文旗鼓相当。

sentences.english: The two teams are well-matched, and the score seesawed all the time.
sentences.chinese: 这两个队旗鼓相当，比赛中比分交替上升。

sentences.english: Are chinee equal to Indians in this matter?
sentences.chinese: 中国人和印度人在这方面是否旗鼓相当？

definition: to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
evenly matched (idiom)
not to know one's place
lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
equally matched/about the same
to become caught up in an irresolvable situation (idiom)
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
hard to untie, hard to separate (idiom); inextricably involved/locked in battle
to take the lead/to gain the upper hand
to be evenly matched/to meet one's match
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
well-matched/equally matched
leeward/downwind/disadvantageous position/to concede or give way in an argument
almost on a par
(sports) draw/tie
